name: The Linden Suites
detail: What really set this hotel apart, though, was the staff.

name: Guijo Suites Makati
detail: I have booked Guijo Suites way back in March for a stay in July. There were not too many comments for Guijo Situes. My friends advised me that the location is good for Makati, so I did decide to book the hotel, as the deal was just very affordable for our 3 nights in Manila. A week prior to my flights I have checked and reviewed the comments of guests who stayed before in Guijo, and there were much more available on comments than before. I got not scared, but I got the feeling that I should probably be aware.. Heading to Manila with a bit stomach ache, as having too of my cousins with me, german nationals never been in Asia before. As we arrived at the hotel, I was very much surprised and pleased by the ambience of the hotel. It is so elegant but yet cozy and very welcoming staff. The rooms were very clean, very nice and just perfect stuffed with the best of the best. You have all you need, and you are totally safe. My cousins stayed a level below.. and they have the same opinion of mine. So I am sharing their opinion as well. We felt very safe as security was around all the time. The staff very accomodating and smiling all the time. I have now found a place, where I will be staying anytime again when I come home to Manila. I just loved the stay, from the first very moment. You have all you need just around the corner. 3 minutes walk, you have a SEVEN ELEVEN, MC DO, SHAKEY'S just like everything is nearby.. so no need to worry about the location, even it is on a narrow street as commented before by others on here.. The location is safe, and we never felt unsafe at all! PERFECT PLACE AT THE PERFECT LOCATION!

name: KL Serviced Residences Managed by HII
detail: Overall, the physical property is alright. The rooms were decent and clean and met a 3-star level. Don't expect anything fancy (the beds are probably the worst part: very hard). Just basic amenities. The price reflects the basic levels of this hotel and is a great find if you get it between $60-70 USD (2015 prices). The best things about this facility are the location (close to a major mall: Greenbelt, where you find shopping and good food, as well as in Makati: the modern international area of Metro Manila) and the attentive staff. One is greeted at the door daily and always willing to help. I would recommend this place to the budget conscious traveler looking for a good room in a thriving part of town.

name: New World Makati Hotel
detail: this is my 8th visit to philippines and i've stayed at 12+ different hotels, 6+ of them 4/5 stars. for value and location this is by far the best hotel in manila. you can save a little more at other hotels in the neighborhood, but end up walking a bit or taking a taxi to entertain yourself. you can spend a lot more money, get more amenities and more comfort, but again, spend some time to get yourself entertained. shangri-la for example is a better hotel, but you will pay for it. dusit sometimes might be cheaper, but it is a cheaper (feel) hotel in what seems to be a back alley. through agoda, you can get excellent deals. for price, location, comfort and safety new world makati is 5 star all the way and an excellent value

name: Solace Hotel
detail: This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in and the best in Manila. Excellent value, very nice room, quiet and very helpful staff. Just around the corner are a range of places to eat and a supermarket. I will definitely stay here again.

name: ZEN Premium Dela Chambre Hotel Manila
detail: We love staying at this hotel every time we’re in Manila!

name: Kingsford Hotel Manila Bay
detail: Despite the noise, I'd still recommend this hotel to others.

name: Belmont Hotel Manila near NAIA Terminal 3 MNL
detail: This is one of the pricier hotels in Manila as it's near the international airport. My favorite thing about our stay in the hotel was the rooftop view from the top floor of the hotel where the pool was also located. You can lounge there while enjoying the view. They also have a sauna and a gym. The staff was also very helpful. They immediately helped me when I got locked out of my room because the automatic doorknob needed a change in battery. The food at the restaurant was delectable. There's a Starbucks on the same building of the hotel and there are a couple other restaurants around the Resorts World area which are easily accessible from the hotel. This hotel accommodated our last minute booking because our supposed first booking at another hotel also got cancelled last minute. Anyway, this hotel turned out to be better than we've expected and it's a great value for your money.

name: Savoy Hotel Manila near NAIA Terminal 3 MNL
detail: Stayed in this hotel for three times already, and I will definitely come back again . The location is good, just across NAIA terminal 3 (they provide a free shuttle bus every hour from the airport to the hotel. You can find the buses at the arrival gate at the ground floor of the airport). There are some restaurants around the area, spa, nail salons, dental clinic, pharmacy store, laundry shop , walking distance to resorts world wherein there’s also a small shopping mall, there is a near supermarket as well. The breakfast buffet is good, and you won’t get sick of the options because everyday they change the choices. The staffs were also amazing! I left my watch in the room during my first stay and they notified me and gave it back. On my third stay, I asked my mom to wait for me at the hotel since I’ll only arrive in the Philippines after a very long flight and they assisted my mom and allowed her to check-in early while waiting for me to land in Manila. Every time I go back to Manila, I choose this hotel and I highly recommend it.

name: Hotel101 - Fort
detail: I love this hotel, with microwave and fridge, very new hotel
area: Bonifacio Global City (BGC) / Taguig,Manila - View on map
